data.title: Square One Television math show on PBS.
data.meta_description: I never got to see this when it was on (because.. well... I think I was probably in school) but it looks fun.
data.text:
Post by Paul on

I never got to see this when it was on (because.. well... I think I was probably in school) but it looks fun. It was sort of a comedy math show that was also a parody of (of all things) Dragnet.

Post by Limity (BLM) on

I LOVED this show. It came on after school, I have so many memories about it and all the various skits. It was set up like a variety show with various sketches and musical pieces, and then the last ten minutes would be an episode of Mathnet.

Along with Mathnet, it also had a running cartoon, Dirk Nibbler of the math brigade.

Post by Spider2024 on

This show gets 8% of my love.

(That sounds like a little, but I've loved many good TV shows over the years. I have a pie chart somewhere illustrating that. )

Post by Allie Kitsune on

The show that introduced us to Reg E Cathey.

Post by Deleted on

Post by Lupin the Third on

@vyse said:

Not gonna lie, that evil Twister guy scared me as a kid.

Post by Lupin the Third on

I think enjoying the Mathnet part of the show was what made me appreciate Dragnet when I got older.

Post by Kevin Hamilton on

Square One ruled. One of Reg E Cathey's first big roles as well.

Post by Kevin Hamilton on

@vyse said:

Not gonna lie, that evil Twister guy scared me as a kid.

My sister and I always rooted for Mr. Glitch

Post by wildojinx on

Why this hasnt shown up on an official Weird Al album is beyond me.

Post by WoodStoner1 on

I think enjoying the Mathnet part of the show was what made me appreciate Dragnet when I got older.

This is another case of knowing the parody before the original for me!

Mathnet, Mathman, and the game show parodies would be the highlights of the show for me.

Post by Paul on

Why this hasnt shown up on an official Weird Al album is beyond me.

The reason is that Al doesn't think it would really work outside of the show (also there's probably some legal issues since he wrote it for use on the show). I was hoping it would be on the "rarities" disc of the box set, but it wasn't.

Post by Paul on

@vyse said:

Not gonna lie, that evil Twister guy scared me as a kid.

That's totally understandable- he sorta freaks me out now!

Post by Rumble McSkirmish on

The show was great and yes Mathnet was the best the part of the series hands down.

The producers agreed because as the series went on the segments went from 8-10 minuets to 15 minuets and after Square One ended its run they took the some of the Mathnet daily episodes and edited them together as an hour long TV movie of the week styled episode.

Also I've mentioned it before (but I'll mention it again) Mathnet did a Pro Wrestling story line with a pre WWF Damien Demento playing the heel wrestler.

Post by carp (SPC, Itoh Respect Army) on

INCREDIBLY catchy songs, on this show. Not surprising, with the CTW people behind it, but it's stuff I still remember to this day.

(sue me; I like shitty 80s rap)

Anyone remember how this show got weird and stupid at the very end? It went from teaching math concepts to kind of just plaintively begging the audience to believe that match is useful everyday life.

Post by Paul on

Man, those are catchy songs. Now I want an album full of them.

Post by Brandon Walsh is Insane. on

Run DMC was on this... which was awesome. And the Fat Bous I think.

Loved this show so much!

Taught me about 1, 1, 2, 3... with Lisa Simpson and that parrot lol

Post by horseface on

I loved the Mathman bits. And I was also a bit frightened by that tornado. He was so vicious toward docile Mathman!

Post by Main Event Mark on

@vyse said:

Not gonna lie, that evil Twister guy scared me as a kid.

lol me too. I remember getting very anxious when Mathman got it wrong.
